headline: Instagram is beefing up its search to compete with TikTok
summary: Instagram head Adam Mosseri says the company is looking to improve the app's search functionality, admitting this is an area where Instagram could do more to compete. The remarks, made on a recent episode of the "Build Your Tribe" podcast, come at a time when younger Gen Z users often turn to social apps like TikTok for answers, instead of using traditional search engines. Instagram is in that mix, too, of course, but it knows its position could be stronger. "We're … starting to invest more in s

headline: Magnificent Seven Stocks Waver
summary: The market is wobbling again, and the Magnificent Seven tech stocks are being swept along.    In recent trading, the stocks varied from a 1.3% loss for Apple to a near-2% gain for Nvidia.   The septet had added nearly $500 billion in market cap, according to Dow Jones Market Data, only for a large chunk of those gains to evaporate.

headline: Waymo may use interior camera data to train generative AI models, but riders will be able to opt out
summary: Waymo is preparing to use data from its robotaxis, including video from interior cameras tied to rider identities, to train generative AI models, according to an unreleased version of its privacy policy found by researcher Jane Manchun Wong, raising fresh questions about how much of a rider's behavior inside autonomous vehicles could be repurposed for AI training. The draft language also reveals Waymo may also share rider data to personalize ads. This isn't new; Waymo already collects personal d

headline: Nvidia And Google Bet Big On Quantum AI With $150M Investment In SandboxAQ, Raising Series E Round To $450 Million
summary: Quantum computing may still feel like science fiction to most, but for a handful of major players, the future is unfolding much faster than expected. Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) and Alphabet (NASDAQ:GOOGL, GOOG)) are the latest to double down on that future, pouring a $150 million investment into SandboxAQ, a startup blending quantum tech with artificial intelligence. That latest funding boost brings the company's Series E total to $450 million and pushes its valuation to $5.75 billion. According to Re

headline: Stock Market Crash: 3 Top Stocks I Plan to Load Up on If the Market Meltdown Continues
summary: My cash position has helped mute some of the impact of the recent major sell-off while providing me with capital to go on the offensive.  Topping my list are Berkshire Hathaway (NYSE: BRK.B)(NYSE: BRK.A), Alphabet (NASDAQ: GOOG) (NASDAQ: GOOGL), and Brookfield Infrastructure (NYSE: BIPC)(NYSE: BIP).  Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway is a wealth-creating machine.
